sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"杀，杀死"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: kill, murder, slaughter, massacre, assassinate, execute
means: kill ： 普通用词，含义广泛，泛指以任何方式使人、动物或植物死亡。
slaughter ： 本义指大批宰杀动物，也指像屠宰牲畜一样一次杀死许多人。
massacre语气比slaughter强。指大屠杀，尤指屠杀失去了自卫能力的人。
assassinate ： 通常指因政治原因用非法手段杀害政治领袖人物或短名人士。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'strike, beat', also 'put to death'): probably of Germanic origin and related to quell. The noun originally denoted a stroke or blow

encyclopedia.content: 单词Kill 1． 杀死；宰 He was killed in the air crash. 他在空难中死去。 2． 扼杀，毁掉 This has killed my hopes. 这使我的希望破灭了。 3． 中和；抵消；削弱The noise killed the music. 噪声淹没了音乐。 4． 使终止；使锛埛⒍蕊級停止 His tactless remark killed the conversation. 他一句不得体的话使谈话无法继续下去了。 5． 消磨锛埵奔滹級 He killed ten good years on that job. 他在那件工作上浪费了整整十

entry.def: If a person, animal, or other living thing is killed, something or someone causes them to die.

example.ex: More than 1,000 people have been killed by the armed forces...
He had attempted to kill himself on several occasions...

entry.def: The act of killing an animal after hunting it is referred to as the kill .

example.ex: After the kill the men and old women collect in an open space and eat a meal of whale meat.
example.tran: 捕杀过后，男人们和老年妇女们聚集到一片空地上吃了一顿鲸鱼肉。

entry.def: If someone or something kills a project, activity, or idea, they completely destroy or end it.

example.ex: His objective was to kill the space station project altogether...
example.tran: 他的目的是使空间站项目全面停止。

example.ex: Public opinion may yet kill the proposal.
example.tran: 舆论可能最终会扼杀这个提议。

entry.def: If something kills pain, it weakens it so that it is no longer as strong as it was.

example.ex: He was forced to take opium to kill the pain.
example.tran: 他被迫服用鸦片来止痛。

entry.def: If you say that something is killing you, you mean that it is causing you physical or emotional pain.
If you say that you kill yourself to do something, you are emphasizing that you make a great effort to do it, even though it causes you a lot of trouble or suffering.

example.ex: You shouldn't always have to kill yourself to do well.
example.tran: 你不该总是为了做到尽善尽美而累坏自己。

entry.def: If you say that you will kill someone for something they have done, you are emphasizing that you are extremely angry with them.

example.ex: Tell Richard I'm going to kill him when I get hold of him.
example.tran: 告诉理查德，一旦抓住他，我要杀了他。

entry.def: If you say that something will not kill you, you mean that it is not really as difficult or unpleasant as it might seem.

example.ex: Three or four more weeks won't kill me!
example.tran: 再过3周或4周不会要了我的命！

entry.def: If you are killing time, you are doing something because you have some time available, not because you really want to do it.

example.ex: I'm just killing time until I can talk to the other witnesses...
example.tran: 在和其他目击者交谈前我只是在打发时间。

example.ex: To kill the hours while she waited, Ann worked in the garden.
example.tran: 为了打发等待的那几个小时，安在菜园里干些活。

entry.tran: (表示强调)即使很难，即便很费力
entry.def: If you say that you will do something if it kills you, you are emphasizing that you are determined to do it even though it is extremely difficult or painful.

example.ex: I'll make this marriage work if it kills me.
example.tran: 再难我也要努力使这桩婚姻幸福美满。

entry.tran: 使笑得前仰后合；使笑死了
entry.def: If you say that you killed yourself laughing, you are emphasizing that you laughed a lot because you thought something was extremely funny.
If you move in for the kill or if you close in for the kill, you take advantage of a changed situation in order to do something that you have been preparing to do.

example.ex: Seeing his chance, Dennis moved in for the kill.
example.tran: 看到机会来了，丹尼斯开始采取行动。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of terminating a life
2. the destruction of an enemy plane or ship or tank or missile;

sentences.sentence: "the pilot reported two kills during the mission"

means.word_mean: 1. cause to die; put to death, usually intentionally or knowingly;

sentences.sentence: "This man killed several people when he tried to rob a bank"
"The farmer killed a pig for the holidays"

means.word_mean: 3. cause the death of, without intention;

sentences.sentence: "She was killed in the collision of three cars"

means.word_mean: 4. end or extinguish by forceful means;
6. be the source of great pain for;
7. overwhelm with hilarity, pleasure, or admiration;

sentences.sentence: "The comedian was so funny, he was killing me!"

means.word_mean: 8. hit with so much force as to make a return impossible, in racket games;

sentences.sentence: "She killed a bottle of brandy that night"
"They popped a few beer after work"

means.word_mean: 12. mark for deletion, rub off, or erase;

sentences.sentence: "kill these lines in the President's speech"
"The daily stress of her work is killing her"

means.word_mean: 15. destroy a vitally essential quality of or in;

sentences.sentence: "Eating artichokes kills the taste of all other foods"

Sentence.sentence: And while TV didn't kill movies, it did kill second-rate pictures, shorts, and cartoons.
And while TV didn't kill movies, it did kill second-rate pictures, shorts, and cartoons.
So when a French submarine (潜水艇) detected the device's homing signal five days later, the discovery marked a huge step toward determining the cause of a tragedy in which 152 passengers were killed.
The Sudan version was deadly enough, killing 50% of those it infected.
Ebola was so deadly and killed so quickly that within a short period of time, there was no one around to infect.
In Pakistan, 1,000women die in honor killings every year.

sentences.en: I was almost killed in the fighting.
sentences.cn: 在战斗中, 我差一点儿被杀死。

means.word_mean: 破坏, 减弱, 抵消

sentences.en: One colour may kill another near it.
sentences.cn: 一种颜色可能使相近的颜色显不出来。

jushi.english: It's easy to kill, but impossible to restore life.
Handle these toxic substances carefully; they can kill.
jushi.chinese: 处理这些有毒物质时要特别小心,它们能使人中毒致死。
